b'In the final episode, Silvia (@silviacalderoni) wanders the phantasmagoric streets of Rome at night, and is drawn into a dreamlike moment involving a dress. As she recites a poem through an intercom in a street doorway, a gentleman inside the apartment, played by singer and actor Lu Han @7_luhan_m, listens while he irons and shortens a dress with a pair of scissors. After a spontaneous ride on a scooter through the nighttime streets of Rome, Silvia returns to where she began, and a walk into the night reveals the underlying nature of her reality. With a cameo from @gus_van_sant. Directed by Gus Van Sant and @alessandro_michele. #GucciFest #GucciOuverture #AlessandroMichele #LuHan

b'\xe2\x80\x9cI just loved it, I got to play in a mythical vintage shop in the most extraordinary Gucci clothes! It made me quite emotional seeing all of Alessandro\xe2\x80\x99s creations from past collections and seeing how much beauty he\xe2\x80\x99s created. Because it was set in a vintage shop, I could see very clearly the vintage inspiration. It was heaven for me, like being inside [Alessandro Michele\xe2\x80\x99s] mind!\xe2\x80\x9d @florence Welch\xe2\x80\x99s look for Episode 6 of \xe2\x80\x98Ouverture Of Something That Never Ended\xe2\x80\x99 featured a ruffled sleeve pliss\xc3\xa9 dress, with a flounced collar and a broad brim felted hat and straw #GucciHorsebit1955 shoulder bag. Photography by @gus_van_sant. Follow the GucciFest fashion and film festival and watch the new episode through link in bio or on @gucci. #GucciFest #GucciOuverture #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele #FlorenceWelch'

b'On the streets of Rome, Silvia (@silviacalderoni) discovers a vintage shop with a neon Gucci sign in the window. As she and a diverse cast of customers begin to try on pieces, an enigmatic woman walks into the store, played by singer and songwriter Florence Welch @florence. The visitor writes out fragments of a poem on pieces of paper, and tucks them away inside the garments. Directed by @gus_van_sant and @alessandro_michele. #GucciOuverture #GucciFest

b'\xe2\x80\x9cIt was very surreal [being on set for \xe2\x80\x98The Neighbours\xe2\x80\x99] as my studio and paintings were recreated for Ouverture, a dream come true since I had wanted to move to Rome to paint. I enjoyed playing the fantasy version of myself, where I could wear a bell sleeve dress and magically create a photorealistic painting while on a swing.\xe2\x80\x9d Part of the cast of the fifth episode: artist @arianapapademetropoulos\xe2\x80\x94who also featured in the @guccibeauty #GucciM\xc3\xa9moire d\xe2\x80\x99une Odeur fragrance campaign\xe2\x80\x94is seen watering plants on a balcony wearing a silk floral printed dress and a #GucciJackie1961 bag, and artist and designer @dariuskhonsary wearing a floral printed dress and new #GucciEyewear. Photography by @gus_van_sant. Follow the GucciFest fashion and film festival and watch the new episode through link in bio or on @gucci. #Gucci1921 #GucciFest #GucciOuverture #AlessandroMichele'

b"We return to the apartment where the day began, but this time meet characters in the homes surrounding, gaining a voyeuristic view into their lives, fantasies and unguarded private moments\xe2\x80\x93including a painter intently cleaning her fake eyelashes, played by artist @arianapapademetropoulos. Someone in a bathtub watches television, as the music video for \xe2\x80\x98Therefore I Am\xe2\x80\x99 by @billieeilish directed by #HarmonyKorine fills our screens, playing in its entirety. These vignettes captured through the frames of the windows ultimately combine into a reversal of perspective, as Silvia once more takes centre stage. Directed by @gus_van_sant and @alessandro_michele. Follow the GucciFest fashion and film festival through link in bio or on @gucci. #GucciFest #GucciOuverture #BillieEilish

b'In this second episode directed by @gus_van_sant and @alessandro_michele, we follow Silvia (@silviacalderoni) to the neighborhood caf\xc3\xa9, where she meets a friend, played by @arlo.parks, the musician and poet from London. They have a meandering conversation until realising they are surrounded by others in a variety of surreal situations. Silvia\xe2\x80\x99s companion leaves to head off on a sightseeing trip around Rome in a car with some friends. The return of the mysterious flyer sets in motion a journey inside a world where all is not as it seems. 
The scenes from the caf\xc3\xa9 explore surreal situations through conversations between characters who are dubbed in Italian with sub-titles; including Silvia and Arlo\xe2\x80\x99s character. The dubbing is an homage to the dubbing heard in Italian vintage cinema. 
#GucciOuverture #GucciFest #AlessandroMichele

b"\xe2\x80\x9cMy character is a philosopher who is talking on TV about the current gender, sexual, and antiracist revolution we are going through right now. It is a little bit me, in the sense that he takes my words and my ideas, but it is also not exactly me, because philosophers rarely speak on TV,\xe2\x80\x9d Paul B. Preciado. Starring alongside @silviacalderoni, in episode 1 'At Home', writer, philosopher and curator #PaulBPreciado wears a reedition of a look from @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s first men\xe2\x80\x99s collection, part of #GucciFW15: a wool-mohair suit with a waistcoat, poplin shirt and black neckbow. b"In this first episode of the seven-part film collaboration between award-winning director @gus_van_sant (Drugstore Cowboy, My Own Private Idaho, Elephant) and Gucci creative director @alessandro_michele, we follow main character Silvia (@silviacalderoni) through her eccentric morning routine at home in Rome, including a scene where she throws a dress\xe2\x80\x94from #AlessandroMichele's first women's show #GucciFW15\xe2\x80\x94off her balcony, to a song by @billieeilish. Silvia is seen sifting through her post, which reveal colorful Gucci show invitations, as well as a mysterious flyer, and then she becomes lost in a television lecture performed by writer and philosopher #PaulBPreciado, until the arrival of an unexpected visitor, while a band in another room rehearses. #GucciOuverture #GucciFest"

b"Writer, philosopher, curator, and one of the leading thinkers in the study of gender, sexual and body politics, Paul B. Preciado features alongside @silviacalderoni in the first episode of \xe2\x80\x98Ouverture Of Something That Never Ended\xe2\x80\x99 directed by @gus_van_sant and @alessandro_michele. The 7-part mini-series presents the new collection by #AlessandroMichele which also features reeditions of looks from his first men\xe2\x80\x99s collection designed for #GucciFW15\xe2\x80\x94including a wool-mohair suit and black neckbow worn by #PaulBPreciado. b"\xe2\x80\x9cOuverture means opening something that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t come to an end. It seemed interesting to help define a time that never ends, and to restart at this moment of suspended time. Creativity is circular, you can\xe2\x80\x99t stop it. While there is storytelling in the films there is no beginning and no ending,\xe2\x80\x9d creative director @alessandro_michele on 'Ouverture Of Something That Never Ended,' the 7-part film series he co-directed with @gus_van_sant. b'Rolling up the door to the #GucciSneakerGarage, a new destination on the Gucci App that takes inspiration from the spirit of garages as the hotbed for talent and ideas, where successful start-ups are born, and the place where some sneakerheads store and categorize their collections. Talents were invited to use diverse mediums to recreate Gucci sneakers, resulting in artworks displayed in a virtual gallery. Connecting to gaming communities, the Gucci Virtual 25 and other Gucci sneaker designs are also available on @agletapp, where they are wearable on immersive platforms @roblox and VRChat through game patches included in the purchase, along with additional customized contents. @alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele Discover more through link in bio.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThe concept came from someone I was seeing who told me that the risk of falling in love was greater than the reward. b'\xe2\x80\x9cI loved being on the other side of the camera. I\xe2\x80\x99m fascinated by the study of light and perspectives. b'\xe2\x80\x9cI loved the idea of trying to make a five-minute western, using all the recognisable tropes of the genre but then filming it in the UK and placing at its centre a mother-daughter relationship.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x98Red Rendezvous\xe2\x80\x99 is written and directed by @emmalouisecorrin. b'\xe2\x80\x9cJackie is about a woman who is alone, but not lonely. In her home, her sanctuary, she chooses to remain uninterrupted, despite the pressures of outside voices. It is a film about escapism. In a world that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t allow her to be carefree, she chooses it\xe2\x80\x93thus, her solitude and the care she takes to get dressed and make herself up are, in some ways, acts of defiance,\xe2\x80\x9d @jodiesmith on \xe2\x80\x98Jackie\xe2\x80\x99 the film she directed for #GucciAbsoluteBeginners. b'\xe2\x80\x9cWith these campaigns, I am working on different ways of being elegant, and these three men embody this idea perfectly. I like to tell the story of elegance in completely arbitrary and unexpected ways. Perhaps elegance is something in the air that sometimes you are not even ready for. Male elegance can be unpredictable and strange,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele on the new #GucciTailoring campaign, with @asaprocky, @feliciathegoat Tyler, The Creator and @iggypopofficial wearing pieces he designed including double-breasted suits, and fabrics featuring jacquard House logos. #AlessandroMichele Discover the collection through link in bio.'

b'Designed by @alessandro_michele, the #GucciTailoring collection features tailored pieces with distinct House patterns, knits and colourful accessories. The looks are captured in a series of imagery with @asaprocky, @feliciathegoat Tyler, The Creator and @iggypopofficial. #AlessandroMichele Discover the collection through link in bio.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cA certain type of fun is also portrayed and the idea of how one\xe2\x80\x99s obsession with appearances can create a kind of common ground that can become a sort of brotherhood. It was beautiful to see these three men together, seemingly different but very similar,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele on the new #GucciTailoring campaign directed by #HarmonyKorine in February. Three artists with distinctive style are in a West Coast home with their pets,@asaprocky, @feliciathegoat Tyler,The Creator, and @iggypopofficial, with his parrot Biggy Pop and a blue hyacinth macaw, at the kitchen table with a pot of spaghetti, at the lounge in the afternoon sunlight. #AlessandroMichele Discover the collection through link in bio.

RAD @radvocacy has partnered with @elizabethstewart1 + @chic_relief to launch \xe2\x80\x98RAD at VENICE\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x94a fundraising and advocacy campaign designed to celebrate the fashion and entertainment industries, while also unifying them through purpose by raising money and awareness for two organizations on the frontlines of gender equality (@unwomen) and racial injustice (@facinghistory and Ourselves). b'\xe2\x80\x9cPerfume is like a spell, and the women wearing it put a spell on the world. Flowers, in this case, mediate this spell, and Gucci Bloom Profumo di Fiori is a powerful conversation with them. It is intense, it really enters the world of nature. Letting the flowers speak, fearlessly, was the real challenge when Alberto Morillas and I created this fragrance,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele on new @guccibeauty fragrance Gucci Bloom Profumo di Fiori\xe2\x80\x94a natural green scent that explores the rich floral quality and creamy depth of Tuberose\xe2\x80\x94shown here with the original scent Gucci Bloom Eau de Parfum. Discover more through link in bio. #GucciBeauty #InBloom #AlessandroMichele #ProfumoDiFiori'

Driving an elegant and distinctive trail, the Orris Concrete is blended with the resinous warmth of the Benzoin and softened with a sensual cloud of Musky notes. b'\xe2\x80\x9cI decided to let the clothes travel towards the houses of the cast of models \xe2\x80\x93 the characters that have embodied my stories for years; individuals I chose precisely, over time, for their uniqueness that usually brings my campaigns to life. I asked them to represent the idea they have of themselves, to go public with it, shaping the poetry that accompanies them. I encouraged them to play, improvising with their life\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele gave the models of #GucciTheRitual campaign no script to follow. b'9/9 \xe2\x80\x9cThe fearlessness of this generation to express themselves gives me hope that a future of freedom and equality is possible,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele designed the ready-to-wear and accessories in MX, which defy gender stereotypes. The pieces of MX feature in a comic strip by @melekzertal commissioned for Issue 4 of @frankenstein_magazine, and the story will continue in the publication for its launch in September. MX is born from the 5-year creative vision of #AlessandroMichele\xe2\x80\x99s collections which take shape in gender fluidity and freedom to express who you are. Discover MX, available exclusively on Gucci.com through link in bio.'

b'8/9 Who is this character? Artist @melekzertal introduces Frankenstein, the puppy mascot of @frankenstein_magazine to their comic strip about identity in celebration of Gucci MX, a curated selection across categories and collections designed by @alessandro_michele that defy traditional stereotypes, celebrating liberty and self-expression. \xe2\x80\x9cFiguring out one\xe2\x80\x99s identity is both tricky for ourselves and our environment. It\xe2\x80\x99s hard enough to go against norms defined by society to find ourselves, we also have to defend it against people around us and sometimes our loved ones\xe2\x80\x99 expectations,\xe2\x80\x9d says the artist. #AlessandroMichele Discover MX, available exclusively on Gucci.com through link in bio.'

b'7/9 Artist @melekzertal draws on their own experience in fashion for the comic strip for @frankenstein_magazine featuring Gucci MX ready-to-wear and accessories, which they describe as \xe2\x80\x9ccomplicated as I don\xe2\x80\x99t really belong to fashion standards, especially growing up in Paris. It took me time to come to terms with my body and which clothes I could wear and used drawing as a starting point; drawing characters that look like me wearing the clothes I wanted to wear made me feel better with trying new things style-wise.\xe2\x80\x9d #AlessandroMichele Discover MX, available exclusively on Gucci.com through link in bio.'

b'6/9 Trying on Gucci MX looks by @alessandro_michele, the characters of @melekzertal\xe2\x80\x99s illustrated comic strip for Issue 4 of @frankenstein_magazine are students who are writing a personal essay on gender and sexual identity. #AlessandroMichele Discover MX, available exclusively on Gucci.com through link in bio.'

b'5/9 \xe2\x80\x9cLet\xe2\x80\x99s start with the idea that the systems of power try to define self-expression,\xe2\x80\x9d the words of character Athon from artist @melekzertal\xe2\x80\x99s comic strip for @frankenstein_magazine in celebration of Gucci MX, a selection of pieces and accessories by @alessandro_michele not belonging to traditional gender stereotypes. #AlessandroMichele Discover MX, available exclusively on Gucci.com through link in bio.'

b'4/9 \xe2\x80\x9cFashion has for a long time been a tool of emancipation; our choice of garments and how we wear them can be very defining of one\xe2\x80\x99s identity\xe2\x80\x94as a lone wolf or part of a pack,\xe2\x80\x9d artist @melekzertal. The characters in their comic strip for the September launch of Issue 4 of @frankenstein_magazine wear #Gucci pieces and accessories including the #GucciJackie1961 bag by @alessandro_michele to celebrate the launch of MX, a curated selection across categories and collections that defy traditional stereotypes. Discover MX, available exclusively on Gucci.com through link in bio.'

b'3/9 Characters Nokia, Gemini and Athon\xe2\x80\x94from artist @melekzertal\xe2\x80\x99s comic strip for the September launch of Issue 4 of @frankenstein_magazine to celebrate Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s MX, a selection of ready-to-wear and accessories by @alessandro_michele. MX is born from the 5-year creative vision of #AlessandroMichele\xe2\x80\x99s collections which take shape in gender fluidity and freedom to express who you are. b'2/9 \xe2\x80\x9cSchool gets you out of your parental home, and throws you in a new world of responsibilities. You have to figure out who you are and what you want to be\xe2\x80\x94and find your chosen family as well. It\xe2\x80\x99s scary, exciting, and boring at the same time.\xe2\x80\x9d Artist @melekzertal chose school as the setting for their comic strip to celebrate MX\xe2\x80\x94pieces across categories and collections designed by \r\n@alessandro_michele that defy traditional gender stereotypes. In this illustration, the #GucciJackie1961 bag is pictured on the desk of a student\xe2\x80\x94wearing a #Gucci knit\xe2\x80\x94pondering an assigned personal essay on gender and sexual identity. @frankenstein_magazine collaborated with the artist on writing the script for the illustrations. #AlessandroMichele Discover MX, available \r\nexclusively on Gucci.com through link in bio.'

b'1/9 Gucci announces MX, a curated selection across categories and collections designed by @alessandro_michele that defy traditional stereotypes, celebrating liberty and self-expression. MX is celebrated by artist @melekzertal in a specially commissioned comic strip ahead of the September launch of Issue 4 of @frankenstein_magazine\xe2\x80\x94the Milan-based publication art directed the work. In this first illustration, the professor is quoted saying \xe2\x80\x9cGender identity is not something static, instead it is dynamic and it is constituted by our daily behaviour and self-expression\xe2\x80\x9d. The professor wears a look from MX of a coat, denim pants and #GucciEyewear. MX is born from the 5-year creative vision of #AlessandroMichele\xe2\x80\x99s collections which take shape in gender fluidity and freedom to express who you are. b'@alessandro_michele redefines one of the House\xe2\x80\x99s most recognizable bags with a genderless attitude and multi-styling. Sourcing a vintage Jackie bag design from his own archive, #AlessandroMichele changed its look by proposing it in a mini size, with a minimal silhouette. Exclusively debuting on Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s website, the small GG motif Jackie 1961 handbag is available now and the leather styles can be pre-ordered. The new bag will be featured in the MX section on Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s website: a hand-picked selection of clothing and accessories with a gender fluid approach launched today. b'#GucciEpilogue is @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s homage to his own design codes and Gucci in the 70s. In place of models there are those who designed the clothes wearing the clothes, members from the Gucci design team. Recurring motifs and pieces include the #GucciJackie1961 bags, #GucciDionysus, #GucciKenScott prints sourced from @kenscott.archives and men\xe2\x80\x99s shoes with @libertylondon #GucciLiberty patterns. Discover more through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele #mfw #MilanoDigitalFashionWeek'

b'To convey the idea that pieces should be able to be worn always, and not just in fashion for one season, inside the 76 #GucciEpilogue looks are @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s own design motifs from the past 5 years. The lineup takes shape in silhouettes inspired by the 70s, with vivid colours and patterns\xe2\x80\x94featuring oversized botanical prints and rainbow stripes sourced from @kenscott.archives, an American designer who lived in Milan in the 60s and 70s. Other collaborations include jewelry pieces featuring Donald Duck and his triplet nephews Huey, Dewey and Louie. Discover more through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele #DisneyxGucci #GucciKenScott #mfw #MilanoDigitalFashionWeek :copyright:Disney @akinoladaviesjr'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThis is my experiment. Narrating it this way, and presenting it this way, to the press, to the outside world, looking inside the mechanism of an advertising campaign, like a peeping Tom,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele on the Narrative Feature filmed in Palazzo Sacchetti in Rome, with art direction by @christophersimmonds and directed by @akinoladaviesjr. Looks are worn by those who design them\xe2\x80\x94the creators become the performers\xe2\x80\x94members of the Gucci design office and other teams of the House. The video features work by digital artist @geoffreylillemon_ and interviews with creative director #AlessandroMichele, photographer Alex Soth @littlebrownmushroom and directors of the campaign Damiano D\xe2\x80\x99Innocenzo and @fabiodinnocenzo. Discover more through link in bio. @kenscott.archives #mfw #MilanoDigitalWeek #AlessandroMichele
Music: \xe2\x80\x9cThe Rhythm Modulator\xe2\x80\x9d

b"Carrying a #GucciJackie1961 bag, a men's look of denim jeans with a 70s silhouette, a coat featuring the GG motif, part of the #GucciEpilogue collection by @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x94worn by those who designed it. b'Yuri wears a dress with oversized florals with a print by Ken Scott. Known as the \xe2\x80\x98gardener of fashion\xe2\x80\x99, the American designer resided in Milan in the 60s and 70s, where he created colourful patterned fabrics and collections, and featured large scale flowers including peonies, roses, poppies and sunflowers. @alessandro_michele delved into the archives of the Ken Scott brands for women\xe2\x80\x99s and men\xe2\x80\x99s looks of the #GucciEpilogue collection. Photography by @mark_peckmezian. Watch the video through link in bio. #mfw #MilanoDigitalFashionWeek @kenscott.archives #GucciKenScott #AlessandroMichele'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThis collection contains the story of the things that I have always made: the blouse with a bow, the long cardigan, the teenage look with jeans and T-shirt tucked into trousers, a down jacket using prints from Ken Scott silk scarves that my aunt used to wear.\xe2\x80\x9d Creative Director @alessandro_michele on #GucciEpilogue. Photography by @mark_peckmezian. Watch the video through link in bio. #mfw #MilanoDigitalFashionWeek #AlessandroMichele'

b'Those who wear the clothes, design the clothes\xe2\x80\x94the models of #GucciEpilogue are part of Gucci design team and other offices including Sabrina who wears a new ready-to-wear look styled with a new handbag design by @alessandro_michele. b'\xe2\x80\x9c#GucciJackie1961 is a bag that was invented when women felt more liberated. Maybe this was the first bag that you could throw on the ground and take into a cafe\xcc\x81 or bistro or bar. You could also talk without taking it off, because it was part of you and had your things inside. In bags before, women kept only the tools they needed to make themselves attractive to men: lipstick, pressed powder. My mother used to work and would go out in the morning like other women who worked\xe2\x80\x94in their bags they would have the things they needed for their own lives and not the things they needed in order to maintain their relationships.\xe2\x80\x9d Photo by Amber Pinkerton @ambercashmere. @alessandro_michele #GucciEpilogue Watch the video through link in bio.'

b'Elements of @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s creative vision over the past six years are part of looks from the #GucciEpilogue collection, including a silk neck tie blouse, worn by David with a suit featuring a colorful @kenscott.archives floral pattern. #GucciKenScott #AlessandroMichele Watch the video through link in bio.'

Photo by @mark_peckmezian. #GucciKenScott #AlessandroMichele Watch the video through link in bio.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThe period of greatest liberation, which I lived through when I was a child, was the 70s, which were really the golden years of the brand I work for, and I keep going back to them because, for me personally they were the real seeds of change,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele. Francesca wears a look from #GucciEpilogue features a flared pant and jacket cinched with a chain belt with GG hardware, and the #GucciJackie1961 bag with elongated shoulder strap. b'The G-Timeless watch is defined by indexes that take the form of bees, an archival code first introduced in Gucci ready-to-wear in the 1970s. For the new collaborative project to celebrate #GucciTimepieces, painter @oh_de_laval used acrylic paint on a cotton canvas and said: \xe2\x80\x9cBoth paintings are inspired by our perceptions of time. I feel the paintings evoke a feeling of running out of time for viewers, now more than ever there is a \r\nuniversal sense rush in our lives.\xe2\x80\x9d Discover more through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele :honeybee:'

b'Part of the new collaborative project to celebrate the G-Timeless automatic watches, artist @zoltar_kieron creates a form of collage and explains: \xe2\x80\x9cI like the idea that the cartoon deals with a parallel world that is a lot like ours.\xe2\x80\x9d The Gucci G-Timeless watch features a stone dial decorated with the House\xe2\x80\x99s bees, while the transparent case back gives a glimpse of the automatic movement that powers the timepieces. Discover more through link in bio. @alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele #GucciTimepieces :honeybee:'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cAll my work is influenced by the happenings that take place in social media from a millennial point of view. I always paint with my phone in front of me, looking at memes, reading twitter or gossiping the \r\nInstagram stories my friends upload. The compilation of all this information translates in implausible compositions, that tell surreal stories, from which the spectator can empathize with the characters that appear, since most of my references are known in the mainstream world. In conclusion, there is not one thing that inspires or influences me, everything has a space in my paintings,\xe2\x80\x9d artist @david_macho_69 on his work featuring the G-Timeless watch. Discover more through link in bio. @alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele #GucciTimepieces :honeybee:'

b'Artists from around the world\xe2\x80\x94including @andreykasay whose artwork is featured here\xe2\x80\x94bring their personal and idiosyncratic perspectives to interpret the G-Timeless automatic watch, focusing on the motif of the bee\xe2\x80\x94the key decorative feature on the stone dials of these #GucciTimepieces, where it functions as every hour-marking index. Discover more through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele :honeybee:'

b'Colorful and imaginative artworks by a variety of illustrators, painters and digital artists found on Instagram, celebrate the G-Timeless watch designed by @alessandro_michele. \xe2\x80\x9cI make personified creatures and shapes called Slollas, which inhabit a spirit world known as the Sayssiworld,\xe2\x80\x9d explained experimental new media artist @balfua about his artworks. Discover more through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele #GucciTimepieces :honeybee:'

b'A lineup of international artists interprets the House\xe2\x80\x99s G-Timeless automatic watch design including @tishkbarzanji who explains: \xe2\x80\x9cThe style I work in came together, after a year of researching colour theory. The relationship between colours, and how they create an atmosphere. I wanted to create work that showed simplicity and complexity, with the rich atmospheres the colours created. I look at deconstruction but also showing raw emotion, and mood of the scene through surrealism.\xe2\x80\x9d The Gucci G-Timeless watch features a stone dial decorated with the House\xe2\x80\x99s bees, while the transparent case back gives a glimpse of the automatic movement that powers the timepieces. Discover more through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele #GucciTimepieces @alessandro_michele :honeybee:'

b'Designed by Creative Director @alessandro_michele, #GucciOffTheGrid is created using recycled, organic, bio-based and sustainably sourced materials, including ECONYL:registered:, made from regenerated Nylon (from abandoned fishing nets, old carpets and other scraps\xe2\x80\x94including plastics that harm marine life and old materials that will likely end up in landfills) coupled with solvent-free recycled polyester (from PET bottles).\n\nShop the collection through link in bio and discover @gucciequilibrium, the House\xe2\x80\x99s commitments and actions to reduce its environmental footprint and protect nature, while supporting people\xe2\x80\x99s rights and championing inclusivity and respect, so that everyone in the global #GucciCommunity is free to express their authentic, diverse selves. #AlessandroMichele #GucciTennis1977'

b'#GucciOffTheGrid is the first collection from Gucci Circular Lines, created in line with the House\xe2\x80\x99s vision for circular production. Messenger bags, hats and wallets are all created using ECONYL:registered:, made from regenerated nylon (from abandoned fishing nets, old carpets and other scraps\xe2\x80\x94including plastics that harm marine life and old materials that will likely end up in landfills) coupled with solvent-free recycled polyester (from PET bottles) as well as recycled materials and more sustainable alternatives. To support a continued cycle, the ECONYL:registered: offcuts are recovered from Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s manufacturing and transformed into new high-quality yarn. \nShop the collection through link in bio and discover @gucciequilibrium, the House\xe2\x80\x99s commitments and actions to reduce its environmental footprint and protect nature, while supporting people\xe2\x80\x99s rights and championing inclusivity and respect, so that everyone in the global #GucciCommunity is free to express their authentic, diverse selves. @alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele'

b'Supported by #Gucci and the Danish foundation Beckett-Fonden, \xe2\x80\x98Stranger Than Kindness: The Nick Cave Exhibition\xe2\x80\x99 presents more than 50 years of @nickcaveofficial\xe2\x80\x99s work and inspiration. Pieces including original artwork, handwritten lyrics, literature, photography, videos, set designs, and collected personal artefacts are shown in a shifting, immersive narrative across eight rooms. The exhibition explores what shapes our lives and makes us who we are, and celebrates the curiosity and power of the creative spirit. Held at The Black Diamond @sortediamant in Copenhagen, #StrangerThanKindness will run until February 13, 2021. Discover more through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele'
location_name: b'Den Sorte Diamant - Det Kgl. Bibliotek'

caption: b'With more than 300 objects collected or created by @nickcaveofficial through six decades of his creative and private life brought together in large-scale installations, \xe2\x80\x98Stranger Than Kindness: The Nick Cave Exhibition\xe2\x80\x99 is an unprecedented look into the musician\xe2\x80\x99s creative world. Created for The Black Diamond of The Royal Danish Library @sortediamant, and with #NickCave as a co-curator and co-designer, the exhibition is an unorthodox fusion of biography, autobiography and fiction. #StrangerThanKindness will run until February 13, 2021. Discover more through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele'
location_name: b'Den Sorte Diamant - Det Kgl. Bibliotek'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cIt [No Space, Just A Place] also evokes a relationship to outer space, a sort utopian place in which to set new empowering narratives, dwelling into the understanding of otherness, minoritarian identities, queer politics, new political and aesthetic relationships between humans, non-humans, the earth and the cosmos\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d curator Myriam Ben Salah @myriambensalah\xe2\x80\x94Executive Director and Chief Curator of the Renaissance Society at the University of Chicago @rensoc. The exhibition aims to support the cultural landscape of South Korea\xe2\x80\x99s contemporary art scene by creating multi-layered project that brings visibility to Seoul\xe2\x80\x99s alternative art spaces and other local and international artists. Historically underground venues that populate storefronts, lofts, warehouses and other places abandoned by the mainstream, these independent art spaces first appeared in Seoul in the late 90s and are famous for promoting work that is often politically engaged, experimental, and more concerned with artistic debates than commercial viability. #NoSpaceJustAPlace is propelled by #Gucci Creative Director @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s meditations on society: the ethical and aesthetic value of the relationships between genres and gender, the notion of learnscapes, the urgency of self-expression and an ageless anthropological manifesto are key themes to him, which are reflected in the mission and ambitions of these alternative spaces. This lays the foundation for a new perspective on the act of \xe2\x80\x9cbeing together\xe2\x80\x9d while not being a single entity. The exhibit will run until July 12, 2020. #AlessandroMichele #GucciPlaces @daelimmuseum'

b'\xe2\x80\x98No Space, Just a Place. Eterotopia\xe2\x80\x99 unfolds in a special video by @artreview_magazine and @nowness. A multi-layered project powered by #Gucci to support the cultural landscape and contemporary art scene in Seoul, #NoSpaceJustAPlace takes its cue from @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s reflections on eterotopia and celebrates the city\xe2\x80\x99s independent art spaces. Curated by Myriam Ben Salah @myriambensalah\xe2\x80\x94Executive Director and Chief Curator of the Renaissance Society at the University of Chicago @rensoc\xe2\x80\x94the exhibit held at the @daelimmuseum features international artists including @oliviaerlanger, @meriembennani, @kangseunglee, #MartineSyms and @cecilebevans. The exhibit will run until July 12, 2020. #AlessandroMichele #GucciPlaces'

b'Inside #Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s exhibition \xe2\x80\x98No Space, Just A Place. Eterotopia\xe2\x80\x99 held at the @daelimmuseum in Seoul. Propelled by Creative Director @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s meditations on society, the exhibit proposes a new definition of what an \xe2\x80\x9cother space\xe2\x80\x9d might be: a place to build a different, desirable future with new ways for humans to relate to each other and to their surroundings. Every project is thematically tied to the idea of the alternative spaces as a utopian place in which to set new empowering narratives, dwelling on the understanding of otherness, the exploration of minoritarian identities and queer politics. The acknowledgment of the moment of great uncertainty that humanity is currently experiencing now furtherly encourages reflections on alternative modes of being and consuming in relation to one\xe2\x80\x99s environment. \xe2\x80\x9cIt seemed very clear to me that as an outsider, the most relevant thing wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be to do something about the Korean scene, but really with Korean cultural producers,\xe2\x80\x9d said curator Myriam Ben Salah @myriambensalah\xe2\x80\x94recently appointed Executive Director and Chief Curator of the Renaissance Society at the University of Chicago @rensoc. #NoSpaceJustAPlace features independent and alternative art spaces as well as international artists\xe2\x80\x99 works including #MartineSyms\xe2\x80\x99 video installation \xe2\x80\x98Notes on Gesture\xe2\x80\x99 (image 1), @oliviaerlanger\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x98Ida, Ida, Ida!\xe2\x80\x99 (image 2), Kang Seung Lee @kangseunglee\xe2\x80\x99s wallpaper installation \xe2\x80\x98Covers (QueerArch)\xe2\x80\x99 and @meriembennani\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x98Party on the CAPS\xe2\x80\x99 (Image 4). Set up by @archiviopersonale, the exhibit will run until July 12, 2020. #AlessandroMichele #GucciPlaces'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cWe share the same passion for faces and an obsession with expressions, personalities and looks. I am a great collector of portraits because the human figure is central to me. Working with a photographer means seeing through someone else\xe2\x80\x99s eyes and it was wonderful to see through Bruce\xe2\x80\x99s eyes,\xe2\x80\x9d says Creative Director @alessandro_michele on his collaboration with photographer @bruce_gilden for \xe2\x80\x98Beaten & Blown by the Wind\xe2\x80\x99. Among those featured in limited-edition art book are American fashion model and activist @bethannhardison (image 4) and the book\xe2\x80\x99s photographer, @bruce_gilden (image 3)\xe2\x80\x94all wearing #GucciPreFall20. \xe2\x80\x98Beaten & Blown by the Wind\xe2\x80\x99 is distributed by @idea.ltd and available at the #GucciGarden in Florence and at the #GucciWoosterBookstore in New York. Read more through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele'

b'A look through the pages of \xe2\x80\x98Beaten & Blown by the Wind,\xe2\x80\x99 the new art book captured by @bruce_gilden. The limited edition book comes in a format inspired by vintage tomes, with photographs printed on textured off-white paper, and the title covered in red velvet with gold foil lettering. Portraits are interspersed with details of the city of Rome and the #GucciPreFall20 collection observed through the photographer\xe2\x80\x99s curious lens. Featured along with citizens of Rome, are Italian musician #AchilleLauro @achilleidol, Italian actress and model #BenedettaBarzini, and American fashion model and advocate @bethannhardison. \xe2\x80\x98Beaten & Blown by the Wind\xe2\x80\x99 is distributed by @idea.ltd and available at the #GucciGarden in Florence and at the #GucciWoosterBookstore in New York. Read more through link in bio. @alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cExploring for me has always been about doing what you can to really discover a new path. Letting go of the that\xe2\x80\x99s just the way we\xe2\x80\x99ve done it mentality!\xe2\x80\x9d Eco-explorer, ecologist, and environmentalist David De Rothschild @thelostexplorer features in the #GucciOffTheGrid campaign, wearing pieces from the new sustainable collection by @alessandro_michele designed for those mindful of their environmental impact. \xe2\x80\x9cWe should maybe look a little bit more aggressively at what is needed to be done, to support a more sustainable future and maybe expedite that pathway and that transition and with that comes, the creation of jobs, comes the creation of resilience, comes to creation of a more, hopefully, robust and healthier relationship with the natural world. And in turn, supports our ability to live on planet Earth, or spaceship Earth I should say.\xe2\x80\x9d #AlessandroMichele See the collection through link in bio and discover @gucciequilibrium, the House\xe2\x80\x99s commitments and actions to reduce its environmental footprint and protect nature, while supporting people\xe2\x80\x99s rights and championing inclusivity and respect, so that everyone in the global #GucciCommunity is free to express their authentic, diverse selves.'

b"Listen to our planet, is @kingprincess69\xe2\x80\x99s message. The singer songwriter and producer is standing in a treehouse, part of the #GucciOffTheGrid campaign. \xe2\x80\x9cPlastic is plastic. And once you eliminate one use of it in your life, it begins to make sense to take more steps away from plastic in general. Again, I'm very much a student [of environmentalism] in all of this, and I wouldn't consider myself a beacon of eco-friendliness yet, but I'm here to listen to the people who know better than me. Our world is angry at us for being so goddam selfish. And if we want to keep living, it's time to listen to her.\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele See the collection through link in bio and discover @gucciequilibrium, the House\xe2\x80\x99s commitments and actions to reduce its environmental footprint and protect nature, while supporting people\xe2\x80\x99s rights and championing inclusivity and respect, so that everyone in the global #GucciCommunity is free to express their authentic, diverse selves."

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThis planet is not ours,\xe2\x80\x9d says @miyavi_ishihara. \xe2\x80\x9cWe all living on this planet and then we need to give back to this planet. Technically everything should be sustainable and then recyclable, even after we die. So, from now on, I mean for next 10 years, I think that might be last chance to make everything sustainable for the future, especially for a younger generation.\xe2\x80\x9d The musician, Ambassador of UNHCR (a United Nations Refugee Agency) and father of two girls has made living responsibly towards the planet and people part of his everyday life. He\xe2\x80\x99s photographed for the #GucciOffTheGrid campaign wearing the indigo blue colored pieces of the collection designed by @alessandro_michele, which are exclusively available in Japan. #AlessandroMichele See the collection through link in bio and discover @gucciequilibrium, the House\xe2\x80\x99s commitments and actions to reduce its environmental footprint and protect nature, while supporting people\xe2\x80\x99s rights and championing inclusivity and respect, so that everyone in the global #GucciCommunity is free to express their authentic, diverse selves.'

b"Academy Award-winning actress, producer, author, activist and founder of #FireDrillFriday @JaneFonda appears in #GucciOffTheGrid campaign, the new collection by @alessandro_michele designed for those mindful of their environmental impact. #JaneFonda says the climate crisis is the defining issue of our time. \xe2\x80\x9cDemand that your government officials invest in clean energy infrastructure. b'@gucciequilibrium is defined by one of its pillars\xe2\x80\x94Planet\xe2\x80\x94to reduce environmental impacts within Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s direct operations and across the entire supply chain and introduce sustainability at every stage of the Gucci creation process\xe2\x80\x94from the design phase where designers think outside traditional material choices, to use alternative and sustainable approaches. Other production and manufacturing processes include the Gucci Scrap-less program, uses less water and chemicals and minimizing the amount of finished leather scraps by tanning only the leather needed for production. Gucci also promotes metal or chrome free tanning for a lower environmental impact and upcycles leather and textile offcuts created during manufacturing through the \xe2\x80\x98Gucci-Up\xe2\x80\x99 program. Discover more on @gucciequilibrium.'

b'@gucciequilibrium is defined by one of its pillars\xe2\x80\x94People\xe2\x80\x94to support people\xe2\x80\x99s rights and championing inclusivity and respect, so that everyone in the global #GucciCommunity is free to express their authentic, diverse selves. The #GucciCommunity unify their voices as Changemakers both inside and outside the company. Gucci Changemakers is a global program that aims to support industry change and to foster unity through community action. Gucci works to convene, unite and strengthen the voices speaking out and fighting for gender equality through its global campaign @chimeforchange. Image courtesy of @globalfundwomen. Discover more on @gucciequilibrium'

b'Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s President and CEO, #MarcoBizzarri explains \xe2\x80\x9c@gucciequilibrium unifies the principles we uphold and the actions we pursue to treat our world and each other better, for our collective future." Marco Bizzarri wrote an open letter to CEOs across industries in November 2019 to come together in the CEO Carbon Neutral Challenge. He proposed they immediately address their entire GHG emissions, taking full responsibility for them. @alessandro_michele, Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s creative director has made self-expression part of his creative vision for Gucci. \xe2\x80\x9cThe fearlessness of this generation to express themselves gives me hope that a future of freedom and equality is possible.\xe2\x80\x9d Marco Bizzarri and #AlessandroMichele stand with Gucci in being committed to reducing the House\xe2\x80\x99s environmental footprint and protecting nature, while supporting people\xe2\x80\x99s rights, diversity and gender equality. Discover more on @gucciequilibrium.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThe fearlessness of this generation to express themselves gives me hope that a future of freedom and equality is possible,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele. Introducing @gucciequilibrium which supports Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s ongoing commitment to generate positive change for people and planet, and aims to inspire and unify a community of voices to join the conversations around topics that are increasingly critical in today\xe2\x80\x99s world. #GucciEquilibrium\xe2\x80\x99s new logos by artist @mp5art represent the interconnection between people and planet. Discover more on the new #GucciEquilibrium site through link in bio. #GucciCommunity #AlessandroMichele'

b"Through Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s North America Changemakers Impact Fund, we will support with donations to @NAACP, @campaignzero and @yourrightscamp, in addition to @Kering_official's commitment on behalf of all @Kering_official brands. \nOn Thursday, June 4th all Gucci operations in the United States will pause for employees to have a day of mourning, honor the lives lost, and recommit ourselves to being part of the solution."

b'6/6 \xe2\x80\xa2 A line of @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s diary, \xe2\x80\x98In the Throes of What is Missing\xe2\x80\x99 written on May 16, 2020: \xe2\x80\x9cNow that we are still apart, my love for fashion burns. Our species, after all, is like that: we love like crazy in the throes of what is missing.\xe2\x80\x9d Read #AlessandroMichele\xe2\x80\x99s diary entries from the past few months through link in bio.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cIt will be the time when we will learn to listen for the sound of the forest growing, at night.\xe2\x80\x9d\nAn illustration by @alessandro_michele from his diary Appunti Dal Silenzio, Notes from the Silence, written during the past few months in Rome. #AlessandroMichele Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'6/6 * In his last two diary entries for these times, \xe2\x80\x98Community of Purpose\xe2\x80\x99 on May 5, 2020 and \xe2\x80\x98In the Throes of What is Missing\xe2\x80\x99 on May 16, 2020, shown here in Italian, English to follow, @alessandro_michele states: \xe2\x80\x9cIn this silence, that is a living thing, my listening embraces all the extraordinary people that I\xe2\x80\x99m connected with. Recalibrating time, to set the pace at a human level, wants to be a promise of revived care towards this amazing community of purpose I proudly belong to. It\xe2\x80\x99s my project, pro-jectum: the art of extending the existence in the future. A plural future, where \xe2\x80\x9cwe\xe2\x80\x9d provides a foundation. A future that contains the hug that today we cannot give each other, but to which we will return with an expanded comprehension.\xe2\x80\x9d #AlessandroMichele Read his diary through link in bio.'

b'5/6 \xe2\x80\xa2 \xe2\x80\x9cI believe that we can build our tomorrow also starting from a renewed capacity of denomination. Here comes the desire to baptize our new encounters by naming them after a language that has marvelously ancient roots: classical music language. Accordingly, there will be symphonies, rhapsodies, madrigals, nocturnes, overtures, concerts and minuets in the constellation of my creative path. Music, after all, has the sacred power to produce reverberations and connections. It travels beyond the borders, reconnecting the fragility to the infinity.\xe2\x80\x9d A new path in fashion that leaves behind the paraphernalia of leitmotifs that colonized our prior world, according to @alessandro_michele in \xe2\x80\x98The Sacred Power of Producing Reverberations\xe2\x80\x99, his diary entry for May 3, 2020. #AlessandroMichele Read his diary through link in bio.'

b'An illustration by @alessandro_michele represents a new beginning. The design is from his diary Appunti Dal Silenzio, Notes from the Silence, written during the past few months in Rome. #AlessandroMichele Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'5/6 * @alessandro_michele announces a new beginning in \xe2\x80\x98The Sacred Power of Producing Reverberations\xe2\x80\x99 is his diary entry for May 3, 2020, shown here in Italian, to follow in English. \xe2\x80\x9cI will abandon the worn-out ritual of seasonalities and shows to regain a new cadence, closer to my expressive call. We will meet just twice a year, to share the chapters of a new story. Irregular, joyful and absolutely free chapters, which will be written blending rules and genres, feeding on new spaces, linguistic codes and communication platforms.\xe2\x80\x9d #AlessandroMichele Read his diary through link in bio.'

b'4/6 \xe2\x80\xa2 \xe2\x80\x9cThat is why I decided to build a new path, away from deadlines that the industry consolidated and, above all, away from an excessive performativity that today really has no raison d\xe2\x80\x99\xc3\xaatre. It\xe2\x80\x99s a foundational act, audacious but necessary, that aims at building a new creative universe. A universe that essentialises itself in the subtraction of events and that oxygenates through the multiplication of sense.\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele writes in his diary, in an entry entitled \xe2\x80\x98A New Creative Universe\xe2\x80\x99 on May 2, 2020 in Rome. #AlessandroMichele Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'Where the possibility to tell finds a new creative universe. @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s illustration for his diary Appunti Dal Silenzio, Notes from the Silence, written during the past few months in Rome. #AlessandroMichele Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'4/6 * Revealing \xe2\x80\x98The New Creative Universe\xe2\x80\x99 is @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s diary entry for May 2, 2020, from these times, shown here in Italian, to follow in English. \xe2\x80\x9cI am fully realizing though, that this possibility to tell cannot be constrained by the tyranny of speed. Now we know that too furious was our doing, too insidious was our ride. In this renewed awareness, I feel the need of a different time, released from other-imposed deadlines that risk to humiliate creativity.\xe2\x80\x9d #AlessandroMichele Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'3/6 \xe2\x80\xa2 \xe2\x80\x9cI understood, as time went by, that these motives have different names and different intensities, but they inevitably gather around the same urgency: the possibility to tell.\nThis possibility, so ancestral and powerful, always gave me the chance to build expressive passages, to make room for that core of the unspeakable that shakes my dreams, to celebrate the nostalgia for the imperfection, to praise the beauty that blossoms from shape to shape.\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele writes in his diary, an entry entitled \xe2\x80\x98The Motive of a Choice\xe2\x80\x99 on April 27, 2020 in Rome. #AlessandroMichele Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'The eye observes, the heart listens. Pictured, @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s illustration for his diary Appunti Dal Silenzio, Notes from the Silence, written during the past few months in Rome. #AlessandroMichele Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'3/6 * @alessandro_michele writes in his diary \xe2\x80\x98Notes from the Silence\xe2\x80\x99 from these times, shown here in Italian, to follow in English. \xe2\x80\x9cThe change I imagine involves the capacity to reconnect with the deepest reasons that inspired my entry into the fashion realm. I feel the need to renew a bond, purifying the essential by getting rid of the unnecessary. I crave the authentic motive of a choice.\xe2\x80\x9d An entry entitled \xe2\x80\x98The Motive of a Choice\xe2\x80\x99 on April 27, 2020 #AlessandroMichele Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'2/6 \xe2\x80\xa2 \xe2\x80\x9cThis present, then, entrusts us with important responsibilities. Everyone can take on responsibilities, according to one\xe2\x80\x99s role and actions, to play a part in a constellation of molecular and widespread changes. As for me, in my own small way, I feel the urgent need to change a lot of things in the way I work. I have always been professionally inclined to change, after all, bringing with me a natural and joyful creative restlessness. But this crisis has somehow amplified such transformative urgency, which can\xe2\x80\x99t be deferred anymore.\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele writes in his diary, an entry entitled About What we Would not Want to be the Same as it Was on April 7, 2020 in Rome. #AlessandroMichele. Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'@alessandro_michele drew this illustration for his diary Appunti Dal Silenzio, Notes from the Silence, written during the past few months in Rome. #AlessandroMichele. Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'2/6 * \xe2\x80\x9cNow that the devastation caught us unprepared, we have to think about what we would not want to be the same as it was. Because the greatest risk, for our tomorrow, is abdicating our responsibility for a true and necessary discontinuity. Our history is littered with crises that taught us nothing.\xe2\x80\x9d About What we Would not Want to be the Same as it Was, April 7, 2020.\n@alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s diary from these times, entitled \xe2\x80\x98Notes from the Silence\xe2\x80\x99, here in Italian, to follow in English, written in his home in Rome. #AlessandroMichele. Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'1/6 \xe2\x80\xa2 \xe2\x80\x9cWe could never have imagined to feel so connected to life through a bond of trembling and heartbreaking tenderness. We could never have thought to reconnect, so deeply, with the fragility of our creatural destiny. Our need for reciprocity. We turned out to be so small. A miracle of nothing,\xe2\x80\x9d We Turned Out to be So Small, March 29, 2020. @alessandro_michele wrote a diary in these months, \xe2\x80\x98Notes from the Silence\xe2\x80\x99. #AlessandroMichele. Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'The eye sees from the heart, an illustration by @alessandro_michele, from his diary Appunti Dal Silenzio, Notes from the Silence, written during the past few months in Rome. Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'1/6 * \xe2\x80\x9cThese days of confinement, in a suspended time that we can hardly imagine as free, I try to ask myself what is the meaning of my actions. It\xe2\x80\x99s a vital and urgent questioning for me, which demands a careful pause and a delicate listening. It\xe2\x80\x99s trying to name, with the precision of love, my fears and my desires.\xe2\x80\x9d We Turned Out to be So Small, March 29, 2020.\nA day from the diary of @alessandro_michele from these times, entitled \xe2\x80\x98Notes from the Silence\xe2\x80\x99, here in Italian, to follow in English, written in his home in Rome. \n#AlessandroMichele. Read the diary entries through link in bio.'

b'Emerging data shows that violence against women and girls has intensified since the outbreak of COVID-19, according to UN Women. In solidarity, we #StandWithWomen worldwide to stop this increase in gender-based violence. Join @chimeforchange and the @kering_official Foundation by donating through link in bio to directly support nonprofit partners working to ensure the safety and health of all women, including women of color, transgender women, Indigenous women and disabled women. Artwork by @mp5art #GucciCommunity #KeringForWomen #GucciEquilibrium @equalitynoworg @msfoundation @globalfundwomen @herfundhk @fondosemillas @fundoelas @mediterraneanwomensfund @chayn_italia @rosaforwomen'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cWe stand in solidarity with women everywhere to put a stop to gender-based violence. We stand in solidarity with women everywhere because we cannot risk the progress we have made in the long fight for gender equality,\xe2\x80\x9d said @chimeforchange Co-Founder and @kering_official Foundation Board Director @salmahayek Pinault who announced today the #StandWithWomen campaign to fight gender-based violence. @chimeforchange and the #KeringFoundation are supporting nonprofit partners @equalitynoworg, @msfoundation, @globalfundwomen, @herfundhk, @fondosemillas, @fundoelas, @mediterraneanwomensfund, @chayn_italia, and @rosaforwomen who are responding to increased violence against women during the COVID-19 pandemic. Artwork by @mp5art. Join us by donating through link in bio. #GucciCommunity #KeringForWomen #GucciEquilibrium'

b'Building on its ongoing efforts to help fight the COVID-19 outbreak, #Gucci, through its @chimeforchange initiative, and the @kering_official Foundation have joined forces for #StandWithWomen, a new campaign to expand funding for nonprofit organizations on the frontlines of supporting women and girls around the world, specifically addressing gender-based violence during the COVID-19 pandemic. We #StandWithWomen by listening to their voices. We stand with women by responding to their unique and various needs. We stand in solidarity with ALL women during this critical time when gender-based violence is increasing and access to health services is limited. Join @chimeforchange and the #KeringFoundation by donating through link in bio to directly support organizations working to ensure continued progress towards gender equality. Artwork by @mp5art #GucciCommunity #KeringForWomen #GucciEquilibrium \n@equalitynoworg @msfoundation @globalfundwomen @herfundhk @fondosemillas @fundoelas @mediterraneanwomensfund \n@chayn_italia @rosaforwomen'

b'Honest and candid self-portraits from #GucciTheRitual with models photographing themselves in the #GucciFW20 collection by @alessandro_michele. @gustavo_cagani is in the garden wearing #GucciUltrapaceR sneakers. #AlessandroMichele #GucciCommunity'

b'At the heart of #GucciTheRitual is an overturning of roles, where the models are the photographers, taking self-portraits dressed in the #GucciFW20 collection by @alessandro_michele, including @vaquel__. The creative director described the process as \xe2\x80\x9cnourishing the campaign with enchantment.\xe2\x80\x9d #AlessandroMichele #GucciCommunity'

b'Crocheting, a self-portrait by @josefine.gronvald for #GucciTheRitual wearing a GG motif bodysuit from #GucciFW20. @alessandro_michele said the final images of the campaign\xe2\x80\x94which features models in photographs taken by themselves\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x9cwas extraordinary for me. In this game of mirrors, that reverses the roles and redefines the functions, every shot breathes as a fresco.\xe2\x80\x9d #AlessandroMichele #GucciCommunity'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThe extravagant hyper-naturalism that I have always tried to depict, now emerges even more authentically and more amazingly,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele on #GucciTheRitual, a campaign featuring the models in their everyday situations, in images taken by them. On the roof with the #GucciDionysus bag, a photo of @flo.w_photography by @flo.w_photography. #GucciFW20 #AlessandroMichele #GucciCommunity'

b'Characters who have embodied @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s stories for years are the protagonists of the campaign #GucciTheRitual. The creative director describes the models as \xe2\x80\x9cindividuals I chose precisely, over time, for their uniqueness. I picked them, once more, because they can\xe2\x80\x99t stop emanating energy and expression. Because they radiate joy and cheerfulness. Because they have intense passions and delicate souls.\xe2\x80\x9d A photograph of Delphi McNicol @delphi_mc and Lawrence Perry @lawrence.perry_ by @delphi_mc and @lawrence.perry_. #AlessandroMichele #GucciFW20 #guccicommunity'

b'A self-portrait for #GucciTheRitual with her pet parrot in Paris, Mae Lapres @meimeilapres wears the #GucciFW20 collection by @alessandro_michele. The model also stars in the @guccibeauty campaign #GucciBeautyNetwork and has featured in Gucci campaigns and fashion shows for several years. #AlessandroMichele #guccicommunity'

b'Carefully building an experiment of magic neorealism with an undetermined outcome, @alessandro_michele gave the models of #GucciTheRitual campaign no script to follow. \xe2\x80\x9cI rather forged the conditions for a combustion: because I longed for a spark able to set a splendidly eccentric human potential on fire.\xe2\x80\x9d Here @sunday_romuald is shown in a self-portrait in Berlin he made for #GucciFW20. #AlessandroMichele #guccicommunity'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cI let the models build their own images. To act as photographers and storytellers, producers and scenographers. I asked them to represent the idea they have of themselves. To go public with it, shaping the poetry that accompanies them. I encouraged them to play, improvising with their life,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele allowed beauty to shine through from the ordinary for the #GucciTheRitual campaign. #AlessandroMichele #GucciFW20 #GucciCommunity

b'\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve always wanted to collaborate with Pierre et Gilles. I like their idea of estrangement from reality, their dialogue with fantasy, with the surreal and with the sacred linked to pop. I find there are many connections with my work. If there is something that needs surrealism and transcendentalism, it is precisely the idea of perfume, so it was therefore natural to work with them on this project." @alessandro_michele\nFirst seen on @guccibeauty, the new campaign to celebrate #GucciFlora is captured by artistic duo #PierreetGilles @pierre_pierreetgilles @pierreetgilles_gilles who reference art history and pop culture to create a fantastical setting. Twisting vines and pale roses complement the new campaign \xe2\x80\x94with creative direction by @alessandro_michele and art direction by @christophersimmonds\xe2\x80\x94featuring Unia @yuniya_p lounging in a scene evocative of an ancient era. Opening with red berries, #GucciFlora Gorgeous Gardenia features an opulent floral heart: White Gardenia petals are enhanced by the Frangipani Flower and underlaid by the aroma of Patchouli and Brown Sugar. Discover more through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele #GucciBeauty'

b'Taking its cue from the complex history of independent and alternative art spaces in Seoul and 
@alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s reflections on eterotopia, \xe2\x80\x98No Space Just A Place\xe2\x80\x99 is a multi-layered project powered by #Gucci to support the cultural landscape and contemporary art scene in Seoul. Seen in image 1 and 2, the independent art space d/p focuses on a space that can never be other: the body, an eternal site from which we can never escape. Through the documentation of choreographer #YunjungLee\xe2\x80\x99s performance \xe2\x80\x98Tongue Gymnastics\xe2\x80\x99, d/p focuses on the movement of the body, of the tongue in particular, addressing it both as a place and an environment for sensations and connections. Image 3 and 4 Audio Visual Pavilion @avpavilion combines works from its archives for the project \xe2\x80\x98AVP Route\xe2\x80\x99 that questions the notions of movement and transition through time and space. Among other artworks, Audio Visual Pavilion 
presents pieces by artist #SunhoPark that examine artifact, memories and vanished spaces, as 
well as geographical information and their eerie materialization through maps. space illi @space_illi_1and2 presents \xe2\x80\x98Swimming QFWFQ*\xe2\x80\x99 (image 5), a project gathering the works of women artists that are linked by their determination to take a closer look at what we consider to be \xe2\x80\x9cnatural\xe2\x80\x9d. By deconstructing and reassembling the concept itself, they create a shift in the viewer\xe2\x80\x99s perspective to reveal the hidden cracks of our contemporary societies. In \xe2\x80\x98I love we 
love we love I\xe2\x80\x99 (seen in image 6), Space One @artspaceone stirs up the illusion of emotion as 
simulacra. Presenting an archive of exhibitions, performances, and talks from the space\xe2\x80\x99s program, the micro-exhibition moves around the boundaries of romanticism and criticism. Held at the @daelimmuseum in Seoul\xe2\x80\x94a location part of the #GucciPlaces network\xe2\x80\x94the exhibit will run until July 12, 2020. Read a special interview with curator @myriambensalah through link in bio. #NoSpaceJustAPlace #AlessandroMichele'

b'The ethical and aesthetic value of the relationships between genres and gender, the notion of learnscapes, the urgency of self-expression and an ageless anthropological manifesto are key themes of #Gucci Creative Director @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s meditations on society, which are reflected in the mission and ambitions of the alternative spaces featured in the new exhibition \xe2\x80\x98No Space Just A Place\xe2\x80\x99. To add to the dialogue, curator @myriambensalah asked a selection of local and international artists to exhibit their works, in the form of immersive installations inspired by the near future or by fantastic mythologies. Kang Seung Lee @kangseunglee\xe2\x80\x99s wallpaper installation \xe2\x80\x98Covers (QueerArch)\xe2\x80\x99 (pictured in image 1 and 2) centers on 
QueerArch\xe2\x80\x99s archival collection to present an alternative view of the queer community and its 
history in South Korea during the past four decades, honoring personal narratives that have been marginalized by mainstream history. #MartineSyms\xe2\x80\x99 video installation \xe2\x80\x98Notes on Gesture\xe2\x80\x99 (image 3) is a reflection on the way gesture, body language and actual language are shaped by cultural forces and allow to perform identity\xe2\x80\x94implying that the latter is a construct and opening up possibilities for alternative identities. Ce\xcc\x81cile B. Evans @cecilebevans\xe2\x80\x99 installation \xe2\x80\x98What The Heart Wants\xe2\x80\x99 (seen in images 4 and 5) explores the person-to-machine exchanges that have come to define the contemporary human condition. Amidst the paradoxes of a future-turned-now, a negotiation emerges about who or what constitutes a person and how systems shape the terms of what it means to be \xe2\x80\x9chuman\xe2\x80\x9d. Held at the @daelimmuseum in Seoul\xe2\x80\x94a location part of the #GucciPlaces network\xe2\x80\x94the exhibit will run until July 12, 2020. Take a virtual tour of the exhibition with a special 360 video available through link in bio. #NoSpaceJustAPlace 
#AlessandroMichele'

b'Propelled by #Gucci Creative Director @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s meditations on society and reflections on eterotopia and curated by @myriambensalah, the new exhibition \xe2\x80\x98No Space, Just A Place\xe2\x80\x99 is held at the @daelimmuseum in Seoul\xe2\x80\x94a location part of the #GucciPlaces network. \nThe exhibit features independent art spaces where artists were invited to give their own definition of what an \xe2\x80\x9cother space\xe2\x80\x9d might be. Pictured here in the first image is the work of artist Sungsil Ryu @sungsilryu\xe2\x80\x94showcased by @boan1942\xe2\x80\x94exploring the notion of artificial paradises. Her installation \xe2\x80\x98Psychedelic Nature\xe2\x80\x99 focuses on secular superstitions and fictitious narratives that link human beings to nature. Image 2 features @hapjungjigu that presents the work of painter #JunHyerim who unpacks through her three dimensional canvases the notion of Arcadia, with its interestingly ambivalent meaning in Korean\xe2\x80\x94meaning both the \xe2\x80\x9cideal land\xe2\x80\x9d and the \xe2\x80\x9cimpossible to realize\xe2\x80\x9d. Tastehouse @tastehouse_info\xe2\x80\x99s project \xe2\x80\x98Tasteview Daelim Branch\xe2\x80\x99 (seen in image 3, 4 and 5) reflects on the notion of value of art and how that value exists within a commercial space. Building an alternative commercial looking space within the museum, a \xe2\x80\x98non-sale shop\xe2\x80\x99, Tastehouse reconnects with the true value of the objects and the status of the viewer as a consumer. #NoSpaceJustAPlace will run until July 12, 2020. Take a virtual tour of the exhibition with a special 360 video available through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele'

b'Images from \xe2\x80\x98No Space, Just A Place\xe2\x80\x99, a new exhibition propelled by Gucci Creative Director @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s meditations on society and reflections on eterotopia. Curated by @myriambensalah, the exhibition spans across the floors of the @daelimmuseum in Seoul\xe2\x80\x94a location part of the #GucciPlaces network\xe2\x80\x94and features independent art spaces which have been invited to give their own definition of what an \xe2\x80\x9cother space\xe2\x80\x9d might be. Historically underground venues that populate storefronts, lofts, warehouses and other places abandoned by the mainstream, these independent art spaces first appeared in Seoul in the late 90s and are famous for promoting work that is often politically engaged, experimental, and more concerned with artistic debates than commercial viability.\nSeen here in images 1 and 2 is \xe2\x80\x98Room\xe2\x80\x99, a project exhibited by the independent art space OF that reflects on the notion of domesticity, of separation between the inside and the outside through three distinct rooms displaying different levels of privacy. Featured in images 3 and 4 is \xe2\x80\x98Secret for Longevity\xe2\x80\x99 by White Noise, which reflects on how to reinvent an artist\xe2\x80\x99s identity through collaboration. In images 5 and 6 the independent art space Post Territory Ujeongguk displays \xe2\x80\x98Lunar Real Estate\xe2\x80\x99 by artist Kang Woohyeok, where he projects onto the moon the possibility of owning land \xe2\x80\x93 a crucial need in Seoul and its immediate region.\n\xe2\x80\x98No Space, Just a Place\xe2\x80\x99 will run until July 12, 2020.  Take a virtual tour of the exhibition with a special 360 video available through link in bio. #AlessandroMichele #NoSpaceJustAPlace'

b'\xe2\x80\x98No Space, Just a Place. Eterotopia\xe2\x80\x99 is a new exhibition sponsored by Gucci, curated by Myriam Ben Salah @myriambensalah and propelled by #Gucci Creative Director @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s meditations on society: the ethical and aesthetic value of the relationships between genres and gender, the notion of learnscapes, the urgency of self-expression and an ageless anthropological manifesto are key themes to him, which are reflected in the mission and ambitions of these alternative spaces. Held at the @daelimmuseum in Seoul\xe2\x80\x94a location part of the #GucciPlaces network\xe2\x80\x94the exhibit will run until July 12, 2020. b'Introducing \xe2\x80\x98No Space, Just a Place. Eterotopia\xe2\x80\x99 a multi-layered project powered by #Gucci to support the cultural landscape and contemporary art scene in Seoul. Taking its cue from the complex history of independent and alternative art spaces in Seoul and Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s Creative Director @alessandro_michele\xe2\x80\x99s reflections on eterotopia, the exhibition proposes a new definition of what an \xe2\x80\x9cother space\xe2\x80\x9d might be: a place to build a different, desirable future with new ways for humans to relate to each other and to their surroundings. Curated by Myriam Ben Salah @myriambensalah, the exhibition is held at the @daelimmuseum in Seoul\xe2\x80\x94a location part of the #GucciPlaces network\xe2\x80\x94and features independent and alternative art spaces as well as international artists\xe2\x80\x99 works including @oliviaerlanger\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x98Ida, Ida, Ida!\xe2\x80\x99 (image 1, 2 and 3) which transforms the space into a laundromat inhabited by mermaid tales and @meriembennani\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x98Party on the CAPS\xe2\x80\x99 (2018-2019): a video installation that follows the imaginary inhabitants of CAPS, an Island in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean where refugees and immigrants \xe2\x80\x9cillegally\xe2\x80\x9d traversing borders are interned. Set up by @archiviopersonale, \xe2\x80\x98No Space, Just a Place\xe2\x80\x99 will run until July 12, 2020. #AlessandroMichele #NoSpaceJustAPlace'

b"Among the artists and talents chosen to share a message of well-being, kindness and joy through creativity is musician Zumi Rosow @fangusz666. \xe2\x80\x9cCole Alexander @oldkingcoleyounger and I, wrote a lot of dreamy songs for our band CRUSH in our bedroom studio. We\xe2\x80\x99ve been collaborating with @_davidblack (our brilliant friend who made @theblacklips_ \xe2\x80\x98Get in On Time\xe2\x80\x99 video) and he figured out a way to film us without being in the same physical space. David would listen to our music and dream about it, using the dream space as his mood board. Cole and I transformed our space into a set and filmed ourselves (No tripod? Tape your phone to a mic stand!). We beam the footage to David, who then projects it through his crystal pyramid portal, transporting us there in holographic form. Then he films us through the crystal with his camera. The song, called \xe2\x80\x98Roam\xe2\x80\x99, is a love song about two vampires who fall in love (love at first bite) under mistletoe, dreaming of one another. We are breaking through the limitations. If you run into a wall, hang something up on it. :rose:\xe2\x80\x9d\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile"

b"Playing guitar, painting and writing songs in this time, @iamkelseylu sings her new song \xe2\x80\x98Astral\xe2\x80\x99 for the #GucciCommunity. \xe2\x80\x9cAstral projection is something of a wonder to achieve, I\xe2\x80\x99ve only dreamt of such a thing. My cello of 18 years broke last week during a tragic fall. I was upset since that\xe2\x80\x99s what most of my compositions revolve around. Luckily, I have this guitar, keyboard and simple art supplies to keep me company, so until another cello comes along (who knows when that will be), The Sonics will be mostly that. Music is a healing tool of magic that brings us all closer together. I feel lucky to be able to share in it and spread that magic hope to the world that so desperately needs it right now.\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile"

b"Sienna Miller @siennathing is pictured with her family\xe2\x80\x99s hamster @marchthehamster. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re each feeling the anguish of this moment and managing it as best we can. I feel incredibly lucky to be safe in quarantine with my family and our animals. I\xe2\x80\x99m trying to focus on the potential that can come from the anguish\xe2\x80\x94the chance we have to join forces for good, regardless of geography and ideological differences. It\xe2\x80\x99s our shared responsibility to do what we can to help, support and appreciate those incredibly courageous people on the front lines. I\xe2\x80\x99m thinking in particular about the work of the International Medical Corps, an organization I have worked and travelled with for over ten years and who are fighting so courageously to help those in need, here in the US and around the world. We need to do everything in our power to contain the virus and support scientists working on a vaccine or cure. I\xe2\x80\x99m looking forward to getting to the other side of this pandemic and I never want to forget that we\xe2\x80\x99ve shared something profound and deeply painful that may, in the end, bring us closer together.\xe2\x80\x9d The actress shares her words with the #GucciCommunity.\n@alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile"

b"An artist and her cat, featuring @alexmerryart. \xe2\x80\x9cThis video shows me putting the finishing touches to a painting I made of our cat, Mabel. I wanted to immortalise her in a portrait and also recognise the importance of all our beloved pets during this time of lockdown. Anyone who knows me will know that I'm already completely in love with her! But having her company during this time has been especially comforting. She loves to sit on my lap while I'm working (quietly purring and overseeing the art work developing) and she helps me to feel less anxious.\xe2\x80\x9d Showing love, solidarity and creativity, #AlexMerry\xe2\x80\x99s work is shared with the #GucciCommunity. @alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile"

b"I chose to sing \xe2\x80\x98Il cielo in una stanza\xe2\x80\x99 (The Sky in a Room) by #GinoPaoli because the lyrics are a poetic masterpiece. Gino Paoli said he wrote it for a prostitute in a brothel in Genoa, and I believe him, but it's amazing how at the same time words can adapt very well to situations very distant from the one that originated them. For example, they are perfect for these surreal days of quarantine; the song is exactly me, the days I'm living, my present. Singing this song makes me feel good, breaks through the ceiling, brings me out of the dark.\xe2\x80\x9d @francesco_bianconi_official\xe2\x80\x94who walked the #GucciCruise18 show in Florence\xe2\x80\x94from @baustelle_official shares this video with the #GucciCommunity as a message of solidarity, kindness and well-being achieved through creativity. #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile."
