b"\xe2\x80\x9cDuring this challenging time, we should get ready for spring with a positive and optimistic attitude. Love your life and move on onwards, someday there will be happiness again.\xe2\x80\x9d Actress #NiNi @captainmiao\xe2\x80\x94who appears in the #GucciEyewear campaign\xe2\x80\x94is holding a dish she cooked. #GucciCommunity.\n@alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile."

b"An animated video by artist @troubleandrew featuring scenes of his daily life, symbols designed by the artist for Gucci clothes and accessories, @alessandro_michele and other faces from the #GucciCommunity. Created with his friend @drewtoonz, the video is part of a music-based animated series called \xe2\x80\x98No Work City\xe2\x80\x99 @noworkcity. The video also features his wife @santigold and their children Honor, Icho and Rad. \xe2\x80\x9cEvery day we have been playing piano together, making up songs, skateboarding in the living room with & drawing and painting together. I\xe2\x80\x99ve been finding some time to work online and with friends while the kids nap each day as well as digging through my scrap books and hard drives reflecting. As I was searching around I found this song I had wrote a while back called \xe2\x80\x98Ride It Out\xe2\x80\x99. It was as if I had wrote it to myself now, knowing what challenges we would be facing in this moment. It has a positive message to keep pushing, keep dreaming, don\xe2\x80\x99t give up, keep going, ride it out!\xe2\x80\x9d #AlessandroMichele\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile"

b"@nickwaplington shares with the #GucciCommunity exclusive unpublished works and a message of hope and well-being nurtured through creativity: \xe2\x80\x9cLike all of you (I hope), I am sheltering in place\xe2\x80\x94but also trying to think beyond the immediate circumstances. For me, art is a way to imagine other, better worlds (past and future). With that in mind, I\xe2\x80\x99m sharing some unpublished works that in different ways look beyond where we are now.\xe2\x80\x9d
Featured in the first and second image, is unseen work from #NickWaplington\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x98Living Room\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x94a photo series made in 1980s\xe2\x80\x94and \xe2\x80\x98Hackney Riviera\xe2\x80\x99 shot in a secret swimming spot in east London during the summer of 2018.  Both works show communities finding joy and togetherness against the backdrop of controversial political circumstances. The third image features a triptych of paintings #NickWaplington is working on from his New York studio. The work doesn\xe2\x80\x99t have a title yet but the artist wanted to share what he is currently working on that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t require travel to locations. The last image was captured in summer 2019 and features joggers on Hackney marshes. The photo is from Nick\xe2\x80\x99s forthcoming book \xe2\x80\x98Anaglypta\xe2\x80\x99 that spans 40 years of his photography and will be published in summer 2020 by @jesusbluebooks. @1972.agency 
#AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele
The #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile."

b"At home, Dani Miller @alienzarereal, a face of the #GucciBeautyNetwork campaign plays music, bakes crescent rolls with pesto and cheese and takes pictures. In her video, she is seen in the living room with her bandmates from @therealsurfbort @chaka_sean and @how_2_tip practicing their new song \xe2\x80\x98Paradise Blues\xe2\x80\x99, originally written and recorded with Surfbort, @davesitek and @daniel_ledinsky. The song is about getting through all of life\xe2\x80\x99s obstacles and pushing through to the better days. [The lyrics] \xe2\x80\x98Anything you want to feel, lives right inside your precious little mind\xe2\x80\x99 speaks to perspective and how powerful the mind can be. \xe2\x80\x98Paradise sucked through a big black hole\xe2\x80\x99 means even in paradise tragedy happens, it\xe2\x80\x99s ok to feel sad, but good things are always on the horizon so never give up!\xe2\x80\x9d. With her camera, Dani is drawn to art and stories from people creating all over the world with her favorite subject the tale of the underdog. Her message for the #GucciCommunity is: \xe2\x80\x9cWe are inspired by art that is used as a tool to overcome struggles. I think now is a good time to remind the world that we are one and to help your neighbor, and most importantly take care of Mother Earth. Celebrate art from the past and make art that is therapeutic and exciting for now.\xe2\x80\x9d\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile"

b"Photographer @derekridgers is hopeful that when the crisis subsides \xe2\x80\x9cwe\xe2\x80\x99ll all have learnt to appreciate life\xe2\x80\x99s small pleasures a great deal more.\xe2\x80\x9d He is spending his time at home reviewing his past work. \xe2\x80\x9cAt times like this, one\xe2\x80\x99s thoughts go back to what life was like before and I\xe2\x80\x99ve been spending this time going through my photographic archive.\xe2\x80\x9d His images are scenes from another time, of young love. He shares his work for creativity, kindness and solidarity for the #GucciCommunity. \nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile"

b"\xe2\x80\x9cAfter the outbreak of the pandemic I flew back to my hometown staying in a place where I lived when I was a child. It's really isolated and close to the ocean. I spend a lot of time observing the rocks and plants and I kept thinking about the relationship between earth, humanity and the virus.\xe2\x80\x9d Artist @johnyuyi\xe2\x80\x94who collaborated with the House on the #TFWGucci project\xe2\x80\x94is one of the talents expressing creativity for kindness, well-being and solidarity for the #GucciCommunity. #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile."

b"One of the largest insect breeders in Europe, @insecthaus_adi, is taking care of his insects near his house in Germany, and his message is to respect and appreciate nature and its creatures. Featured here his bees and a Tropidacris cristata, the largest Grasshoper species in South America. This species comes from Venezuela and has a generation period of three years which is extremely long in the insect world. His videos are part of a series of artists and talents who express a message of empathy, kindness and well-being to the #GucciCommunity. #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele \nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile."

b'\xe2\x80\x9dNature is trying to tell us to appreciate what we have and to live in the moment, good or bad to accept it for what it is, love and learn from it before we move on to the next one.\xe2\x80\x9d @lilnasx is one of the talents sharing a message of well-being and love for nature to the #GucciCommunity on #EarthDay2020.\nDiscover more about our commitment to environmental and social change through link in bio.\n@alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele #GucciOffTheGrid'

b'On #EarthDay2020, guitarist and singer, and ambassador of UNHCR (a UN Refugee Agency) @miyavi_ishihara shares a message with the #GucciCommunity. \xe2\x80\x9cCherry blossoms were blooming without being seen this year due to coronavirus, and it made me realize how beautiful this world still is without us. Quarantine reminds us not to take our existence on Earth for granted. It\xe2\x80\x99s hard to imagine a world without humans but we must never forget our responsibility to give back to a planet that has already given us so much.\xe2\x80\x9d #GucciOffTheGrid Discover more about our commitment to environmental and social change through link in bio.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cWhat a beautiful Earth we are destroying\xe2\x80\x9d. Sharing a video taken with a horse in Maui, Hawaii, singer, songwriter and producer @kingprincess69 expresses her love for nature and our planet on #EarthDay2020 for the #GucciCommunity. #GucciOffTheGrid Discover more about our commitment to environmental and social change through link in bio.'

b"David De Rothschild @thelostexplorer says our connection to Earth on\xc2\xa0#EarthDay2020\xc2\xa0is even closer in this moment.\xe2\x80\x9cIn times of chaos, there is nothing more grounding than taking off your shoes so you can feel the earth under your feet. This Earth Day should probably hold a more poignant place in our hearts than the last 50, as for the last few months Mother Nature has sent us all to our rooms to pause and reflect.\xc2\xa0If our current pandemic has reminded me of anything, apart from how vulnerable and precious all life is, it\xe2\x80\x99s also just how deeply interconnected and codependent we all are.\xc2\xa0Business, society, nature, me and you, we\xe2\x80\x99re all part of the same big beautiful web of life. It\xe2\x80\x99s clich\xc3\xa9d to say, but if you keep on relentlessly pulling on one thread finally something has to give.\xc2\xa0So, as we re-emerge from our cocoons, there won't be any easy answers, no final destination, and certainly no one-size-fits-all solution but the interconnectivity that threatened us all, might just also be our most promising hope for restoring the balance.\xe2\x80\x9d The eco-explorer, ecologist and environmentalist is one of the talents who shares his ideas of well-being, solidarity and kindness to others and our planet with the #GucciCommunity. Discover more about our commitment to environmental and social change through link in bio.\n@alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele #GucciOffTheGrid #DavidDeRothschild"

b'Activist, actress @janefonda is an advocate for climate change action, who has and continues to campaign on Capitol Hill, in Washington DC in a red coat\xe2\x80\x94depicted in this portrait of her protesting on #FireDrillFridays. As a symbol of solidarity on this day, #JaneFonda shared an image of an artwork on wood of an Inuit inspired design from her own personal collection with a message to all on #EarthDay2020: \xe2\x80\x9clisten to the voices of indigenous peoples. They are the water protectors, the forest protectors. We must protect their rights so they can protect the earth for all of us\xe2\x80\x9d. #JaneFonda is one of the talents who shares a sentiment of well-being, solidarity and creativity for the #GucciCommunity. @alessandro_michele #AlessandroMichele #GucciOffTheGrid Discover more about our commitment to environmental and social change through link in bio. \nPortrait by @marcantoinecoulon'

b'@alessandro_michele: \xe2\x80\x9cthis photo was taken last summer in France, in Ch\xc3\xa2teau de Chambord\xe2\x80\x99s park. The oak tree is my favorite tree, it is absolutely the tree I love most, an ancient, resistant tree. I have many other favorites, another is the Paulownia tree (original Japanese name kiri \xe6\xa1\x90), which has purple flowers in spring, then the flowers fall and the leaves sprout. Below my house in Rome there are some Paulownias, planted in the 1800s, which I admire from the window." #AlessandroMichele\xe2\x80\x99s message for the #GucciCommunity on #EarthDay2020 is that nature is trying to tell us something, and we should listen closely to what it has to say. #GucciOffTheGrid Discover more about our commitment to environmental and social change through link in bio.'

b'"If you believe in love, the nightmare will inevitably come to an end. If you only believe in dreams, the nightmare will never end\xe2\x80\x9d a quote by author Andr\xc3\xa9 Gide\xe2\x80\x94who won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1947\xe2\x80\x94shared with the #GucciCommunity by @therealmickrock as a message of hope. I thank the gods for art and beauty, to sustain our spirits and our love until this nightmare is over.\xe2\x80\x9d #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele\r\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo\'s #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection \nDepartment #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile.'

b"@arianapapademetropoulos picks up her brushes to paint bubbles in electric hues. \xe2\x80\x9cIn my work and in life, the fantastical exists in the everyday. My house is just an extension of this; so if I can make my house whimsical, it transports me to a magical place full of possibilities. In this time I wanted to paint bubbles, and it felt like the perfect moment to finally do so.\xe2\x80\x9d The artist is among the talents who through creativity, convey messages of inspiration, well-being and kindness in this time to the #GucciCommunity. \n#AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele\r\nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile."

b"I always thought that creativity, in difficult moments, would save us. In our minds we have everything we need,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro.borghi  is at home with his partner during this time, making collages. \xe2\x80\x9cWe simply tried, like others, to give time to our ideas, using boxes and everything we can now only imagine. These days have produced a beautiful memory.\xe2\x80\x9d The actor from Rome is one of the talents expressing creativity for kindness, well-being and solidarity for the #GucciCommunity.\n #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele \nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile"

b"Out of all the family pictures photographer @bradelterman shares with the #GucciCommunity, his favorite is the glamour photo of his mom, Frances (the black and white studio image). \xe2\x80\x9cAfter college mom worked at Fox Studios for Irving Lazar and for the writer James Hilton. One day a photographer at the studio asked to take her photograph. Mom had no desire to be an actress. It was just for fun. I also love the daily life photo I took of my mom and dad staining the kitchen cabinets. They loved each other very much and were best friends. Besides family, art and especially LACMA was incredibly important to mom and dad.\xc2\xa0 One night, they were photographed together at the grand opening night of LACMA.\xe2\x80\x9d Brad is thinking about the words his mom used to say to him during difficult moments, \xe2\x80\x9cshe really was a guiding light for me. She told me many times that at the end of the day everything will work out. Things will be better in the morning. I have always remembered those words and I find her message incredibly calming today.\xe2\x80\x9d Brad is passing his time at home in a secret canyon in Los Angeles where he takes photos of \xe2\x80\x9cglorious tiny yellow and green breasted canaries in the garden. They sing to me each morning\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x98good morning Brad\xe2\x80\x99.\xe2\x80\x9d The images of his family are a message of creativity, love and well-being in this time. #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele \xe2\x80\xa8The\xc2\xa0#GucciCommunity\xc2\xa0stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s\xc2\xa0#COVID19\xc2\xa0Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization\xc2\xa0@who, and locally with\xc2\xa0@intesasanpaolo's\xc2\xa0#ForFunding\xc2\xa0campaign which supports the Italian Civil ProtectionDepartment\xc2\xa0#DipartimentoProtezioneCivile."

b'\xe2\x80\x9cIn this moment of utter spare time, I realized the importance of a dialogue with my family and has given me the chance to spend time and actually show how much I care for my family," Kai @zkdlin shares some photos for the #GucciCommunity in a message of solidarity, kindness and well-being. #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele \nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo\'s #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile'

b"Photographs by @ellefanning depict objects and nature through the \xe2\x80\x9cfuzzy blur of a zoom. It feels disconnected, yet gets close at the same time. I\xe2\x80\x99m trying to take the time to look at everything in my life from a different perspective.\xe2\x80\x9d While staying at home, she sees her neighborhood with a new point of view. \xe2\x80\x9cMy eyes have been more open and able to pick up on the details during this quarantine time. I have been taking walks around my LA neighborhood and zooming in on things that interested me that I normally would not have taken the time to look at.\xe2\x80\x9d Being creative means having the time to learn more about yourself, she adds, \xe2\x80\x9cI feel like I have been brought back to my childhood roots also. I am coloring with crayons again. looking at the dolls on my shelf at my mom\xe2\x80\x99s house, and dying my hair fun colors.\xe2\x80\x9d Creativity nurtures well-being, kindness and joy, from a collection of works created at home by talents and artists for the #GucciCommunity. #AlessandroMichele\xc2\xa0@alessandro_michele \xe2\x80\xa8The\xc2\xa0#GucciCommunity\xc2\xa0stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the\xc2\xa0@unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s\xc2\xa0#COVID19\xc2\xa0Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization\xc2\xa0@who, and locally with\xc2\xa0@intesasanpaolo's\xc2\xa0#ForFunding\xc2\xa0campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0#DipartimentoProtezioneCivile."

b"@lucio_corsi plays his song \xe2\x80\x98Cosa faremo da grandi?\xe2\x80\x99 which translates as \xe2\x80\x98What will we do when we grow up\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x94the lyrics are about a way of life where the starting point is celebrated more than the finish and was inspired by the Maremma, the Tuscan coast of Italy, and of the around the world adventures by Italian sailor Ambrogio Fogar. The singer songwriter from Tuscany, who walked in the #GucciCruise18 fashion show in the Palatine Gallery in Florence, wants to express a message that in this moment peace of mind can be found by seeking solace in nature\xe2\x80\x99s rhythms. Lucio Corsi is one of the talents who show the #GucciCommunity kindness, solidarity and well-being through their work. #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele \nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department  #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile."

b"Photographer and director @_glen_luchford reflects on \xe2\x80\x98The Fighting Temeraire\xe2\x80\x99, an artwork by Joseph Mallord William Turner which resonates with him in this time, which he shares with the #GucciCommunity. \xe2\x80\x9cAs a teenager I visited The National Gallery, and became transfixed by this painting. It has a real heart shattering sadness to it. It\xe2\x80\x99s not my favourite painting. But it\xe2\x80\x99s so profound, that whenever we go through a crisis it reappears in my dreams, full of Freudian meaning. No one painting, film, or piece of literature ever captured so perfectly the transition from aged beauty to the banality of modern life, for me. When Covid-19 first took hold I found myself dreaming of the old ship. Back to haunt me in my dreams. But as the days have passed I\xe2\x80\x99ve started to see her in a new light. The transition from old to new suddenly seems inspiring. Our lives have spun so far out of control, that the simplification of sitting at home with family, staring at a painting, reading a book, playing games, re-learning the art of conversation is something to be cherished. And from that will emerge great art and creativity.
Some of us won\xe2\x80\x99t recover, others will experience poverty and hard times, but all of us will have learnt something valuable, and personally I\xe2\x80\x99m feeling excited about the possibilities. I\xe2\x80\x99m ready for the new ship, or maybe to go back to the old one.\xe2\x80\x9d
#AlessandroMichele\xc2\xa0@alessandro_michele\xc2\xa0
The\xc2\xa0#GucciCommunity\xc2\xa0stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the\xc2\xa0@unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s\xc2\xa0#COVID19\xc2\xa0Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization\xc2\xa0@who, and locally with\xc2\xa0@intesasanpaolo's\xc2\xa0#ForFunding\xc2\xa0campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0#DipartimentoProtezioneCivile. \xe2\x80\x98The Fighting Temeraire\xe2\x80\x99, 1839 (oil on canvas), Joseph Mallord William Turner / National Gallery, London, UK /\xc2\xa0 Photo :copyright: copyright Bridgeman Images"

b"Pictured, @eltonjohn\xe2\x80\x99s notebook where he is at home searching for and listing new artists for his Rocket Hour weekly radio show, hosted by Apple Music. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m listening to lots of new music, discovering new artists and preparing my Rocket Hour radio show to share my discoveries with the world.\xe2\x80\x9d The singer songwriter and performer message to the #GucciCommunity is that from hard times, great creativity is born. \xe2\x80\x9cOut of difficult periods like this comes extraordinary creativity.\xc2\xa0 I\xe2\x80\x99m excited to see and hear the creative voices that will emerge from this global crisis.\xe2\x80\x9d If he could choose a song to define this period it would be \xe2\x80\x98We Are Family.\xe2\x80\x9d\xc2\xa0#AlessandroMichele\xc2\xa0@alessandro_michele \xe2\x80\xa8The\xc2\xa0#GucciCommunity\xc2\xa0stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the\xc2\xa0@unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s\xc2\xa0#COVID19\xc2\xa0Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization\xc2\xa0@who, and locally with\xc2\xa0@intesasanpaolo's\xc2\xa0#ForFunding\xc2\xa0campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0#DipartimentoProtezioneCivile"

b"Surgical gloves, yellow rose and hand mudras by Willy Ndatira @williamcult who explains: \xe2\x80\x9cThe yellow rose in the language of flowers represents friendship, joy and good health. b"An intimate moment of togetherness between mother and child, @sokothecat is pictured with her son at home. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s time to slow down and cherish your loved ones. It\xe2\x80\x99s time to build forts out of 
sheets and pillows and reclaim your inner child. It\xe2\x80\x99s time to create a magical place to feel safe and let your imagination go wild and free. It\xe2\x80\x99s time to sing books instead of reading them. But mostly, 
it\xe2\x80\x99s time to be kind to yourself.\xe2\x80\x9d Kindness, creativity and closeness\xe2\x80\x94even for those who are physically apart\xe2\x80\x94is a message from the talents and artists for the #GucciCommunity. b'@thesineadburke is photographed nurturing seedlings: "I\'m in my family home in Ireland and we have never been the gardening type. I have even been known to allow cactus\' to whither\xe2\x80\x94unintentionally. This moment\xc2\xa0has given me an opportunity to reflect, and learn a new skill which I\'m putting to the test with my sunflowers and tomatoes. I\'ve learned that caring for plants must be individualistic, with so much gained from instigating the five senses. Nature is trying to tell us something. For plants to thrive, they require patience and selflessness\xe2\x80\x94an oxymoron to our current climate."\xc2\xa0Talents and artists delve into creativity as a message to the #GucciCommunity of well-being, solidarity and kindness.\n#AlessandroMichele\xc2\xa0@alessandro_michele\xc2\xa0\nThe\xc2\xa0#GucciCommunity\xc2\xa0stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the\xc2\xa0@unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s\xc2\xa0#COVID19\xc2\xa0Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization\xc2\xa0@who, and locally with\xc2\xa0@intesasanpaolo\'s\xc2\xa0#ForFunding\xc2\xa0campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0#DipartimentoProtezioneCivile.'

b"\xe2\x80\x9cMy sketchbook pages are based on photos and videos from my friends in Italy when the lockdown first happened. At the end of the sketchbook is when the lockdown had hit London and I wanted to delve into ideas of fantasy and other worlds from history and ancient myths. I went from feeling the need to document this strange time to enjoying the slow rhythm of creativity that this lockdown has inspired.\xe2\x80\x9d Artist @isabellacotier believes during this time, people will seek their own ways of being creative, whether through cooking, sewing, figuring out how to sunbath in a tiny patch of sunshine, or finding new and inventive ways to support frontline and essential workers. b"\xe2\x80\x9cI have an obsession with hands. Mankind shaped and keeps on shaping the world with its hands. They are the tools that make us be in relation to ourselves and to others. Hands save, comfort, caress, create, invent, prevent, shake, shape, and also can hurt, hit, kill. We are what we do with our hands, and so many choose to save lives with their hands, save our hearts, our lungs, our lives. I wanted to honor the ring of hands, all over the world that are keeping us alive. The medical hands, the feedings hands, the soothing hands, the washing hands, the driving hands, the stay at home hands\xe2\x80\xa6 May the hands come together, love and encourage kindness.\xe2\x80\x9d A message by @loudoillon about her artwork. #GucciCommunity #AlessandroMichele @alessandro_michele \nThe #GucciCommunity stands behind aiding those most vulnerable in this crisis, join by donating now to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and locally with @intesasanpaolo's #ForFunding campaign which supports the Italian Civil Protection Department #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile."

b"\xe2\x80\x9cThe stillness is forcing us all to reimagine ourselves, reimagining a tomorrow that we don\xe2\x80\x99t even know when it\xe2\x80\x99ll come. However, I am imagining it as different, even better maybe. Essentially, I feel very different,\xe2\x80\x9d @alessandro_michele is pictured at his home in Rome with his two Boston terriers Bosco and Orso, where he is spending the time between working, reading poetry and re-reading the novel \xe2\x80\x98The Magic Mountain\xe2\x80\x99 by Thomas Mann, \xe2\x80\x9cit\xe2\x80\x99s an incredible novel, where this apparently still time is told in a sublime way,\xe2\x80\x9d then knitting and learning to play the guitar. b"Gucci supports the World Health Organization @who on fighting #COVID19. For older adults and people with underlying conditions: Be prepared and know in advance where and how to get practical help if needed, like calling a taxi, having food delivered and requesting medical care.
Keep regular routines and schedules as much as possible or help create new ones in a new environment, including: regular exercising, cleaning, daily chores, singing and painting. Learn simple daily physical exercises you can perform at home. 
We Are All in This Together #GucciCommunity #StaySafe #FlattenTheCurve

b"What is the difference between isolation, quarantine and distancing? Gucci supports the World Health Organization @who on fighting #COVID19. Quarantine means restricting activities or separating people who are not ill themselves, but may have been exposed to COVID-19. Isolation means separating infected people to prevent the spread of COVID-19, Physical distancing means being physically apart but socially connected, for example with digital tools. b'We Are All In This Together. Gucci stands with its global #GucciCommunity to fight the #COVID19 pandemic, and donated \xe2\x82\xac2 million to two crowdfunding campaigns. Join with us and give now. \nGucci donated \xe2\x82\xac1 million to the @unfoundation\xe2\x80\x99s COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who though Facebook\xe2\x80\x99s US $10 million Matching Fundraiser. Today the donations are at $5.5 million, which come from a mix of donations including those from the Gucci community from the past week, help us reach the $10 million target by donating through the Donate Sticker on our Stories. \nGucci supports its home country of Italy with a donation of \xe2\x82\xac1 million to the valiant efforts of the #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile through @intesasanpaolo\xe2\x80\x99s #ForFunding crowdfunding platform to reinforce the nation\xe2\x80\x99s health services and to source new ICU beds. b'Take care of yourself and your family. Gucci supports the World Health Organization @who on fighting #COVID19. For caregivers at home who are aiding those with suspected or confirmed #coronavirus should:
Ensure the ill person rests, drinks plenty of fluids and eats nutritious foods. Wear a medical mask when in the same room with an ill person. Do not touch the mask or face during use and discard it afterward. Frequently clean hands with soap and water and alcohol-based rub, especially: after any type of contact with the ill person or their surroundings, before, during and after preparing food, before eating, after using the toilet. Use dedicated dishes, cups, eating utensils, towels and bedlinens for the ill person. Wash dishes, cups, eating utensils, towels, or bedlinens used by the ill person with soap and water. Identify frequently touched surfaces by the ill person and clean and disinfect them daily. Call your health care facility immediately if the ill person worsens or experiences difficulty breathing. 
We Are All in This Together #GucciCommunity #StaySafe #FlattenTheCurve
Join with us and donate now to our crowdfunding campaigns through swiping up on our Stories: the United Nations Foundation\xe2\x80\x99s Covid-19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization\xe2\x80\x94through the Donate Sticker, and locally on gucci.forfunding.it to the Italian Civil Protection Department #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile.  @alessandro_michele'

b'Following our recent posts on Gucci social media accounts to support the World Health Organization\xe2\x80\x99s #Covid19 information for the health and safety of the community, we are resuming normal posting with a focus on health and well-being.\nGucci is partnering with The Sex Ed podcast for Season 3. An intersection of sex, health and consciousness, the podcast is born from The Sex Ed\xe2\x80\x99s digital platform which has a mission to inspire conversations around sexual wellness and explore the ways sexuality is experienced and expressed. Episodes feature host Liz Goldwyn (@goldilocksg) in conversation with clinical experts across sexual medicine fields and reproductive health, as well as cultural voices, artists and influencers that are shaping the dialogue around sex education, sexuality, gender, entertainment and wellness. Illustrated animation of Liz Goldwyn wearing #GucciEyewear, and the #GucciOrgasmique Horsebit bag both from the #GucciSS20 collection by @alessandro_michele by @instagrandmaw for @blkwmnanimate x @TheSexEd. Listen to The Sex Ed podcast through swiping up in our Stories #TheSexEdxGucci  #AlessandroMichele'

b'Gucci supports the World Health Organization @who with a message on #Covid19. Be active at stay healthy at home during the #Covid19 outbreak. Keeping active every day is good for your mind, body and spirit especially during these difficult times. The more physical activity you can do improves your sleep which is also important for good health. The World Health Organization recommends 30 mins a day of physical activity for adults and 1 hour a day for children. For those working from home, regularly check your sitting posture, and break up your sitting by standing while working, on the phone or watching tv. We Are All in This Together #GucciCommunity #StaySafe #FlattenTheCurve\r\nJoin with us and donate now to the the United Nations Foundation\xe2\x80\x99s Covid-19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization through the Donate Sticker on our Stories. This is this week\xe2\x80\x99s last post of messages on Gucci social media accounts to support the World Health Organization. The Gucci Social media accounts will continue to post @WHO public service information on Sundays and Mondays about the Covid-19 virus to protect the health, safety and well-being of the community. @alessandro_michele'

b'A message from the World Health Organization @who on #Covid19. These are 7 simple steps to protect yourself and others from the virus. 1. Wash your hands frequently. 2 Avoid touching your eyes, mouth and nose. 3. Cover your cough with a bend of your elbow or a tissue. 4. Avoid crowded places. 5. Stay at home if you feel unwell\xe2\x80\x94even with a slight fever or cough. 6. If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical care\xe2\x80\x94but call first. 7. Stay aware of the latest information from World Health Organization. We Are All in This Together #GucciCommunity #StaySafe #FlattenTheCurve @alessandro_michele\nJoin with us and donate now to the United Nations Foundation\xe2\x80\x99s Covid-19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization with the Donate Sticker on our Stories.'

b'Do the Five. Gucci supports the World Health Organization @who on official messages for the #Covid19 crisis. Be ready to fight #Covid19 by doing the five. 1. Wash Hands: frequently with soap and water or an alcohol-based solution. 2. Cover Cough: Cover your nose and mouth with a bent elbow or a tissue when you sneeze or cough. Dispose of tissue immediately and wash your hands. 3. Don\xe2\x80\x99t Touch. Avoid touching your face, particularly your eyes, nose or mouth to prevent the virus from entering your body. 4. Keep Distance. In terms of social distance, take a step back. Stay at a safe distance from others. 5. Stay Home. If you feel unwell, stay home. Please follow all instructions provided by your local health authorities. We Are All in This Together #GucciCommunity #StaySafe #FlattenTheCurve\nJoin with us and donate now to the United Nations Foundation\xe2\x80\x99s Covid-19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization through the Donate Sticker on our Stories. @alessandro_michele'

b'We Are All in This Together. Gucci stands with its global community to fight the #Covid19 pandemic by making two separate donations to crowdfunding campaigns. Locally, in Italy where the company is based, a 1 million euros donation to the Italian Civil Protection Department #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile in partnership with @intesasanpaolo\xe2\x80\x99s #ForFunding platform to reinforce Italy\xe2\x80\x99s health services and to source new ICU beds. Globally, Gucci donated 1 million euros to the United Nations Foundation\xe2\x80\x99s Covid-19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who through Facebook\xe2\x80\x99s US$10 million Matching Fundraiser to monitor and collect data on the spread of the virus to strengthen ICUs across the world, supply protection equipment to health personnel and fast-track the creation of vaccines and therapies. The initiatives are captured in an original illustration gifted by Rome-based artist @mp5art, a person who holds their hand on their heart a message of human solidarity. \xe2\x80\x9cGucci has created a world, open and free: a Gucci global community. We ask all of you to be the changemakers in this crisis, to stand together with us in the fight against the Coronavirus. We are all in this together,\xe2\x80\x9d say @alessandro_michele, Creative Director of Gucci, and #MarcoBizzarri, President and CEO of Gucci. Calling on our #GucciCommunity to join with us, give through our Donate Sticker on Stories to the United Nations Foundation\xe2\x80\x99s Covid-19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization @who, and on gucci.forfunding.it to donate to the Italian Civil Protection Department #DipartimentoProtezioneCivile. Discover more about the crowdfunding campaigns through link in bio. Starting from tomorrow, Gucci\xe2\x80\x99s social channels will feature the official messages of @who to help spread useful information and prevention for the virus. #StaySafe #FlattenTheCurve'

b'With a view to providing a lasting response to the current pandemic, @kering_official, which includes Gucci, contributes to the fight against Covid-19.\nIn the days ahead, the Group will provide the French health service with surgical masks and its preparing to manufacture new ones\xe2\x80\x94while complying with the strictest health protection measures for its staff members\xe2\x80\x94and made a financial donation to the Institut Pasteur to support its research into Covid-19. This contribution follows those already made in China and Italy in recent weeks. On March 11 in Italy, Kering and its Houses made donations to the four major foundation hospitals in Lombardy, Veneto, Tuscany and Lazio. More recently, Gucci responded to a call to fashion companies from the Tuscany Region for surgical masks and medical overalls, and aims to donate to 1.1 million surgical masks and 55.000 medical overalls in the coming weeks, subject to relevant authorizations. On January 28 in China, Kering and its Houses announced a donation to the Hubei Red Cross Foundation to help fight the spread of the virus.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s something though, in this ceremony, that usually stays buried: the struggle of the parturient that accompanies the tremble of creation; the mother\xe2\x80\x99s womb where poetry blooms, from shape to shape. Therefore, I decided to unveil what lies behind the curtains. May the miracle of skillful hands and holding breath come out of the shadows,\xe2\x80\x9d from the women\xe2\x80\x99s #GucciFW20 show notes, handwritten in Italian by Creative Director @alessandro_michele. \xe2\x80\x98Un rito che non ammette repliche\xe2\x80\x99, which translates to \xe2\x80\x98An Unrepeatable Ritual\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x94swipe left to read the English version. The new collection unfolds at 3:00pm CET at the Gucci Hub in Milan. Watch the show live on Instagram Stories or through link in bio. #GucciTheRitual #mfw #AlessandroMichele'

b'Captured at the @worldeconomicforum in Davos, President and CEO of #Gucci #MarcoBizzarri together with @jenniferbmorgan, Co-CEO and Member of the Executive Board of @sap. The innovation and technology company announced it is joining Marco Bizzarri\xe2\x80\x99s #CEOCarbonNeutralChallenge, pledging to take responsibility for their total GHG emissions. \xe2\x80\x9cAs businesses, we must all own up to the total GHG emissions our activities generate and, at the same time, invest in nature-based solutions to protect our world\xe2\x80\x99s critical forests and biodiversity, simultaneously helping to mitigate climate change,\xe2\x80\x9d said Marco Bizzarri. \xe2\x80\x9cI applaud SAP\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to join the CEO Carbon Neutral Challenge. The leadership they are showing by doing so will help create a future in which society can thrive and business can succeed, while nature is restored and protected.\xe2\x80\x9d The CEO Carbon Neutral Challenge is open to CEOs across industries to come together for climate action right now, discover more through link in bio.\xc2\xa0#sustainability #wef20 #carbonneutral'

b'\xe2\x80\x98It\xe2\x80\x99s time to celebrate a man who is free to practice self-determination, without social constraints, without authoritarian sanctions, without suffocating stereotypes. A man who is able to reconnect with his core of fragility, with his trembling and his tenderness. A man on his knees in front of surrender, who honors fears and its thorns. A man full of kindness and care,\xe2\x80\x99 from the men\xe2\x80\x99s #GucciFW20 show notes \xe2\x80\x98Masculine Plural\xe2\x80\x99 which speak about the toxic stereotypes that mould masculine gender identity. b'Looking at @VogueItalia\xe2\x80\x99s January covers created by seven artists including graphic novel illustrator @MiloManara_official who spoke about his artwork featuring a lace gown with a narrow GG belt detail from the #GucciSS20 collection: \xe2\x80\x9cFor my cover I referenced the greatest of models, Michelangelo\xe2\x80\x99s David, but in female form. Other covers were created by artists: @Cas_Amandaa, @Yoshitaka_Amano, @DelphineDesane @DelphineDesaneStudio, @Paolo.Ventura, @David_Salle and Vanessa Beecroft @VBuntitled.
